column1: Requirements: Minimaal een afgeronde bachelor opleiding in Technische Informatica en/of Software Engineering
column2: Minimaal een certificaat in Scrum Foundations en/of Scrum Master
column3: Minimaal zeven (7) jaar werkervaring met diverse programmeertalen en tools waaronder in ieder geval Java en/of Python
column4: Minimaal vijf (5) jaar werkervaring met Postgres en/of Elasticsearch en/of Bamboo en/of Javascript
column5: Minimaal vijf (5) jaar werkervaring met het werken in het forensisch domein
column6: Minimaal drie (3) jaar werkervaring met Kubernetes en/of docker en/of Istio
column7: Aantoonbare ervaring met het schrijven van automatische testen
column8: Aantoonbare ervaring in het vertalen van requirements naar technische en/of functionele analyses

column1: Preferences: Creatieve puzzelaar die zich graag vastbijt in complexe uitdagingen en doorgraaft tot de oplossing gevonden is
column2: Teamspeler die energie krijgt van samenwerken en graag het initiatief neemt
column3: Kritisch en werkt op een nauwkeurige en systematische manier en toetst resultaten bij collega's
column4: Pragmatische aanpak vanuit een oplossingsgerichte instelling
column5: Graag kennis en ervaringen deelt en nieuwsgierig is naar de ideeën van anderen

column19: 'Subject: Application for the position of Software Engineer at Ministry of Justice and Security (JenV)\n\nFrom: John Doe on behalf of MareVisie B.v.
column22: \n\nI am writing to express my interest in the Software Engineer position at the Ministry of Justice and Security
column23: as advertised. With a robust background in technical computing and software engineering
column24: complemented by over a decade of hands-on experience in diverse programming environments
column25: I am excited about the opportunity to contribute to your team.\n\nI hold a Bachelorâ€™s degree in Software Engineering and have accumulated significant professional experience
column27: where I have developed and maintained complex software solutions for over 15 years. My technical proficiency extends to working with Postgres
column30: and JavaScript for more than six years
column31: which has equipped me with a deep understanding of data handling and software development processes in forensic domains.\n\nIn my previous roles
column32: I have demonstrated a strong capability in translating complex requirements into actionable development plans and technical analyses. This experience is underpinned by a solid foundation in Scrum methodologies
column35: solution-oriented approach to project management. My tenure in software development has been marked by a keen attention to detail
column37: and a systematic approach to problem-solvingâ€”qualities that I understand are valued at JenV.\n\nMoreover
column38: my experience with Docker and Kubernetes over the past five years has enabled me to excel in creating scalable and efficient containerized applications
column41: and maintainable systems architecture. My commitment to professional development and teamwork is reflected in my proactive engagement in knowledge sharing
column42:
fostering an environment of continuous improvement and innovation.

I am particularly drawn to this role at JenV due to its alignment with my skills and my keen interest in contributing to projects that have a meaningful impact on public security and justice. I am enthusiastic about the possibility of bringing my background in forensic software development and my technical expertise to your esteemed organization.

Thank you for considering my application. I look forward to the opportunity to further discuss how I can contribute to the Ministry of Justice and Security. Please feel free to contact me at your earliest convenience to schedule an interview.

Warm regards
